thesis.title: Optimal Real-Time Bidding for Display Advertising
thesis.author: Weinan Zhang

papers.title: Adaptive Targeting for Online Advertisement
papers.problematic: Making fast decisions on whether to show a given ad to a particular user based on information extracted from big data sets containing records of previous impressions, clicks and subsequent purchases.
papers.solution: Strategies for maximizing the click-through rate and provide some results of statistical analysis of real data

papers.title: Adaptive Bidding for Display Advertising
papers.problematic: The bidding agent must acquire a given number of impressions with a given target spend, when the highest external bid in the marketplace is drawn from an unknown distribution P. The quantity and spend constraints arise from the fact that display ads are usually sold on a CPM basis.
papers.solution: Consideration of both a full-information setting where the winning price in each auction is announced publicly, and the partially observable setting where only the winner obtains information about the distribution. The latter algorithm perfoms nearly as well as the first despite the penalty incurred during learning.

papers.title: Machine learning for targeted display advertising: Transfer learning in action
papers.problematic: Acquiring sufficient data for training from the ideal sampling distribution is prohibitively expensive.
papers.solution: Design of a multi-stage transfer learning system, highlighting the problem formulation aspects.

papers.title: Ad Exchange: Intention Driven Auction Mechanisms for Mediating Between Publishers and Advertisers
papers.problematic: None of the previously proposed solutions fully take into account the preferences of the publishers.
papers.solution: Developed solutions for the case of multiple advertisers and multiple publishers, while considering the publishers' preferences. Proposition of three mechanisms: (i) the Hungarian VCG, (ii) the Simultaneous English Auction and (iii) the Distributed Relocation Protocol

papers.title: Ad Exchange Optimization Algorithms on Advertising Networks
papers.problematic: In selecting the best candidate from all possibilities algorithms able to process the advertiser's requirements in tenths of seconds are needed.
papers.solution: Developed algorithms using techniques such as threads, AVL trees with hash, multiple node trees or Hadoop technology.

papers.title: Multi-Touch Attribution in Online Advertising with Survival Theory
papers.problematic: The drawback of rule-based models lies in the fact that the rules are not derived from the data but only based on simple intuition
papers.solution: New-data driven attribution model based on survival theory. The model is able to remove the presentation biases inherit to most of the other attribution models and can predict the user's 'conversion probability'.

papers.title: Programmatic Buying Bidding Strategies with Win Rate and Winning Price Estimation in Real Time Mobile Advertising
Bid Landscape Forecasting in Online Ad Exchange Marketplace
papers.problematic: One important business model in online display advertising is Ad Exchange marketplace, also called non-guaranteed delivery (NGD), in which advertisers buy targeted page views and audiences on a spot market through real-time auction
papers.solution: We describe a bid landscape forecasting system in NGD marketplace for any advertiser campaign specified by a variety of targeting attributes.

papers.title: Real Time Bid Optimization with Smooth Budget Delivery in Online Advertising
Causally Motivated Attribution for Online Advertising
papers.problematic: The process of assigning conversion credit to the various channels is called 'attribution', and is subject of intense interest in the industry.
papers.solution: Presents a causally motivated methodology for conversion attribution in online advertising campaigns. Need for the standardization of attribution measurement and offer three guiding principles to contribute to this standardization.

papers.title: Implicit Look-Alike Modelling in Display Ads: transfer collaborative filtering to CTR estimation
papers.problematic: There is no previous work that explicitly investigates the user online visits similarity and incorporates such similarity into their ad response prediction.
papers.solution: We propose a transfer learning model based on the probabilistic latent factor graphic models, where the users' ad response profiles are generated from their online browsing profileS.

papers.title: A Convolutional Click Prediction Model
papers.problematic: For click prediction on single ad impression, we have access to pairwise relevance among elements in an impression, but not to global interaction among key features of elements. The existing method on sequential click prediction treats propagation unchangeable for different time intervals.
papers.solution: We propose a novel model, Convolutional Click Prediction Model (CCPM), based on convolution neural network. CCPM can extract local-global key features from an input instance with varied elements, which can be implemented for not only single ad impression but also sequential ad impression.

author: Flavian Vasile
Damien Lefortier
Olivier Chapelle
papers.problematic: One of the most challeging problems is the prediction of ad click and conversion rates. One unadressed problem in the previous approaches is the existence of highly non-uniform misprediction costs.
papers.title: Cost-sensitive Learning for Utility OPtimization in Online Advertising Auctions
papers.solution: We show that one can get significant lifts in offline and online performance by using a simple modification of the logistic loss function.

papers.title: Offline Evaluation of Response Prediction in Onine Advertising Auctions
papers.problematic: Click-through rates and conversion rates are two core machine learning problems in online advertising. The evaluation of such systems is often based on traditional supervised learning metrics that ignore how the predictions are used.
papers.solution: Empirical evaluation of a metric that is specifically tailored for auctions in online advertising and show that it correlates better than standard metrics with A/B test results.

papers.title: Estimating Conversion Rate in Display Advertising from Past Performance Data
papers.problematic: Conversion probability estimation is a challenging task since there is extreme data sparsity across different data dimensions and the conversion event occurs rarely.
papers.solution: We model the conversion event at different select hierarchical levels with separate binomial distributions and estimate the distribution parameters individually. We demonstrate how we can combine these individual estimators using logistic regression to accurately identify conversion events.

papers.title: Data-driven Multi-touch Attribution Models
papers.problematic: The attribution problem focuses more on accurate and stable interpretation of the influence of each user interaction to the final user decision rather than just user classification. Traditional classification models fail to achieve those goals.
papers.solution: We first propose a bivariate metric, one measures the variability of the estimate, and the other measures the accuracy of classifying the positive and negative users. We then developed a bagged logistic regression model. We also propose an intuitive and simple probabilistic model to directly quantify the attribution of different advertising channels.

papers.title: Deep Learning over Multi-field Categorical Data: a case study on User Response Prediction
papers.problematic: Major user response prediction models have to either limit themselves to linear models or require manually building up high-order combination features. The former loses the ability of exploring feature interactions, while the latter results in a heavy computation in the large feature space.
papers.solution: Propose two novel models using deep neural networks (DNNs) to automatically learn effective patterns from categorical feature interactions and make predictions of users' ad clicks. We propose to leverage three feature transformation methods: factorisation machines (FMs), restricted Boltzmann machines (RBMs) and denoising auto-encoders (DAEs).

papers.title: Modeling Delayed Feedback in Display Avertising
papers.problematic: Conversions can take place long after the impression - up to a month - and this delayed feedback hinders the conversion modeling.
papers.solution: Introducing an additional model that captures the conversion delay. Intuitively, this probabilistic model helps determining whether a user that has not converted should be treated as a negative simple - when the elapsed time is larger than the predicted delay - or should be discarded from the training set - wehn it is too early to tell.

papers.title: Optimal Revenue-Sharing Double Auctions with Applications to Ad Exchanges
papers.problematic: Platforms often face intense competition from similar market places, and such competition is likely to favor auction rules that secure high payoffs to sellers. What selling mechanism should platforms employ?
papers.solution: Study optimal mechanism deisgn in settings plagued by competition and two-sided asymmetric information, and identify conditions under which the current practice of employing constant cuts is indeed optimal.

papers.title: Dynamics of Bid Optimization in Online Advertisement Auctions
Predicting ad click-through rates via feature-based fully coupled interaction tensor factorization
papers.problematic: In addition to challenges similar to those encountered in sponsored search advertising, such as data sparsity and cold start problems, more complicated feature interactions involving multi-aspects, such as the user, publisher and advertiser, make CTR estimation in RTB more difficult.
papers.solution: We consider CTR estimationg in RTB as a tensor complement problem and propose a fully coupled interactions tensor factorization (FCTF) model based on Tucker decomposition (TD) to model three pair-wise interactions between the user, publisher and advertiser and ultimately complete the tensor complement task.

papers.title: A Field Guide to Personalized Reserve Prices
papers.problematic: Setting and testing reserve prices in single item auctions when the bidders are not identical.
papers.solution: We show that the two version have dramatically different properties: lazy reserves are easy to optimize, and A/B test in production, whereas eager reserves always lead to higher welfare, but their optimization is NP-complete, and naive A/B testing will lead to incorrect conclusions. We prove that the eager auction dominates the lazy auction on revenue whenver the bidders are independent or symmetric.

papers.title: Predicting Response in Mobile Advertising with Hierarchical Importance-Aware Factorization Machine
papers.problematic: Ad response data change dynamicall over time, and are subject to cold-start situations in which limited history hinders reliable prediction. There is also a need for a robust regression estimation for high prediction accuracy, and good ranking to distinguish the impacts of different ads.
papers.solution: Hierarchical Importance-aware Factorization Machine (HIFM), which provides an effective generic latent factor framework that incorporates importance weights and hierarchical learning.

papers.title: Factorization Machines with Follow-The-Regularized-Leader for CTR prediction in Display Advertising
papers.problematic: Predicting ad click-through rates
papers.solution: We present an online learning algorithm for click-through rate prediction, namely Follow-The-Regularized-Leader (FTRFL) with pre-coordinate learning rates into Factorization machines. The method outperforms the baseline with stochastic gradient decent, and has a faster rate of convergence.

papers.title: Handling Forecast Errors While Bidding for Display Advertising
papers.problematic: The online strategy is typically highly dependent on both supply and expected price distributions, both of which are forecast using traditional machine learning methods.
papers.solution: We investigate the optimum strategy of the bidding agent when faced with incorrect forecasts.

papers.title: Evaluating and Optimizing Online Advertising: Forget the click, but there are good proxies
papers.problematic: Measuring success if critical both for evaluating and comparing different targeting strategies, and for designing and optimizing the strategies in the first place. Proxies are necessary because data on the actual goals of advertising often are scarce, missing or fundamentally difficult or impossible to observe.
papers.solution: Across a large number of campaigns, clicks are not good proxies for evaluation nor for optimization. Predictive models built based on brand site visits do a remarkably good job of predicting which browsers will purchase. Evaluating campaigns and optimizing based on clicks seems wrongheaded.

author: R. Preston McAfee
Kishore Papineni
Sergei Vassilvitskii
papers.problematic: When a seller (publisher or website) with some degree of price-setting-ability or market power, has an extremely large variety of goods for sale and cannot control exactly the product mix available. The key problem is the large variety of distinct goods for sale.
papers.title: Maximally representative allocations for guaranteed delivery advertising campaigns
papers.solution: The present study derives a method of pricing such advertisements based on their relative scarcity while ensuring that all campaigns obtain a reasonably representative sample of the relevant opportunities.

papers.title: Real-Time Bid Optimization for Group-Buying Ads
papers.problematic: Group-buying ads seeking a minimum number of customers before the deal expiry are increasingly used by the daily-deal providers. Traditional static bidding strategies are far from optimal.
papers.solution: We propose a real-time bidding strategy for group-buying deals based on the online optimization of bid values.

papers.title: Lift-Based Bidding in Ad Selection
papers.problematic: The bid price per ad impression is typically decided by the expected value of how it can lead to a desired action event to the advertiser. This industry standard approach to decide the bid price does not consider the actual effect of the ad shown to the user.
papers.solution: We prove that if the bid price is decided based on the performance lift rather than absolute performance value, advertisers can actually gain more action events.

papers.title: Bid Optimizing and Inventory Scoring in Targeted Online Advertising
papers.problematic: This paper presents a bid-optimization approach that is implemented in production.
papers.solution: The approach combines several supervised learning algorithms, as well as second-price auction theory, to determine the correct price.

papers.title: Budget Pacing for Targeted Online Advertisements at LinkedIn
papers.problematic: In a greedy mechanism high performing advertisers tend to drop out of the auction marketplace fast and that adversely affects both the advertiser experience and the publisher revenue.
papers.solution: Description of a method for improving such ad serving systems by including a budget pacing component that serves ads by being aware of global supply patterns.

papers.title: Multi-Armed Bandit with Budget Constraint and Variable Costs
papers.problematic: Study the multi-armed bandit problems with budget constraint and variable costs
papers.solution: Propose two UCB based algorithms for the new setting. The first algorithm needs prior knowledge about the lower bound of the expected costs when computing the exploration term. The second algorithms eliminates this need by estimating the minimal expected costs from empirical observations, and therefore can be applied to more real-world applications where prior knowledge is not available.

papers.title: Multi-Touch Attribution Based Budget Allocation in Online Advertising
papers.problematic: How to best allocate campaign budget so that the advertiser or campaign-level ROI is maximized.
papers.solution: We employ both last-touch (last ad gets all credit) and multi-touch (many ads share the credit) attribution methodologies.

papers.title: Optimal Real-Time Bidding for Display Advertising
Optimal Real-Time Bidding Strategies
papers.problematic: The optimization problems faced by companies building bidding strategies are new and interesting for the community of applied mathematicians.
papers.solution: Introduce a stochastic control model that addresses the question of the optimal bidding strategy in various realistic contexts: the maximization of the inventory bought with a given amount of cash in the framework of audience strategies, the maximization of the number of conversions/acquisitions with a given amount of cash, etc. The sequence of auctions is modeled by a Poisson process and the price to beat for each auction is modeled by a random variable following almost any probability distribution. The optimal bids are characterized by a Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman equation, and that almost-closed-form solutions can be found by using a fluid limit.

papers.title: Real-Time Bidding Rules of thumb: analytically optimizing the programmatic buying of ad-inventory
papers.problematic: Optimization aspects of ad-inventory buying through real-time bidding, by taking as starting point the fundamental mathematical relationships between the different variables involved.
papers.solution: We focus on three tactical issues: (1) comparative statics relating the different macroscopic variables important for the operation of an advertising campaign (2) optimal bidding across different aggregates of inventory and (3) optimal budget pacing.

papers.title: Optimal budget-pacing for Real-Time Bidding
papers.problematic: How to smooth the spent throughout the day in an optimal fashion
papers.solution: Introduce an optimization framework based on variational calculus which permits to obtain closed formulas for the budget-pacing problem in RTB. The optimal spending is not linear but proportional to the number of auction-requests we observe. The same framework can be applied in the presence of frequency-capping.

papers.title: Selling Off Privacy at Auction
papers.problematic: The emergence of bidding technologies allows companies to exchange user data as a product and therefore raises important concerns from privacy perspectives.
papers.solution: Perform a privacy analysis of CM and RTB and quantify the leakage of users' browsing histories due to these mechanisms

papers.title: Bidding for Representative Allocation for Display Advertising
papers.problematic: This correlation between price and value means that a selle implementing the contract through bidding should offer the contract buyer a range of prices, and not just the cheapest impressions necessary to fulfill its demand. Implementing a contract using a range of prices, is akin to creating a mutual fund of advertising impressions, and requires randomized bidding.
papers.solution: Characterize what allocations can be implemented with randomized bidding, namely those where the desired share obtained at each price is a non-increasing function of price. Provide a full characterization of when a set of campaigns are compatible and how to implement them with randomized bidding strategies.

papers.title: Real-Time Bidding for Online Advertising: Measurement and Analysis
papers.problematic: Provide first-hand insights into the emerging new impressions selling infrastructure and its bidding behaviours, and help identifying research and design issues in such systems.
papers.solution: Periodic patterns occur in various statistics including impressions, clicks, bids, and conversion rates. Significant needs for optimisation algorithms incorporating the facts such as the temporal behaviours, the frequency, and recency of the ad displays.

papers.title: Statistical Arbitrage Mining for Display Advertising
papers.problematic: Despite the new automation, the ad markets are still informationally inefficient due to the heavily fragmented marketplaces. Two display impressions with similar or identical effectiveness may sell for quite different prices at different market segments or pricing schemes.
papers.solution: We propose a novel data mining paradigm called Statistical Arbitrage Mining (SAM) focusing on mining and exploiting price discrepancies between two pricing schemes. It's a meta-bidder that hedges advertisers' risk between CPA-based campaigns and CPM-based ad inventories; it statistically assesses the potential profit and cost for an incoming CPL bid request against a portfolio of CPA campaigns based on the estimated conversion rate, bid landscape and other statistics learned from historical data.

papers.title: Information Disclosure in Real-Time Bidding
papers.problematic: Information about target audiences is usually disclosed to advertisers, while information about publishers are typically not available for advertisers, especially in real-time setting. Serious information asymmetry problem in RTB markets, which has significant influence on both advertisers' bidding strategies and publishers' revenues.
papers.solution: Study the information disclosure strategies of publishers in case when the disclosure may incur an extra cost: all disclosed, non-disclosed and partially disclosed.

papers.title: Optimizing Bidding Algorithm of Real-Time Bidding in Online Ads Auction
papers.problematic: There is little study on the macro-level auction mechanism, especially the characteristics of the general winning bids.
papers.solution: This paper conducts and empirical analysis of average deal price and bidding volume at different times of impressions. We design and optimized method for delivery of RTB ads through offline experiments.

papers.title: Real-Time Bidding Algorithms for Performance-Based Display Ad Allocation
papers.problematic: The current practice is to solve the optimization problem offline at a tractable level of impression granularity but this approach fails to scale to ad delivery decision making at an individual impression level.
papers.solution: Propose a rtb algorithm that enables fine-grained impression valuation, and adjusts value-based bid according to real-time constraint snapshot. One algorithm adjusts bids against real-time constraint satisfaction level using control-theoretic methods, and the other adjusts bids also based on the historical bidding landscape statistically modeled.

papers.title: Pricing Externalities in Real-Time Bidding Markets
papers.problematic: The resulting differential impression pricing is only visible to publishers as a positive externality to revenue unless they collect the same audience targeting information.
papers.solution: We introduce a Bayesian hierarchical model of auction clearing price that can naturally account for the presence of publisher-advertiser information asymmetry and quantify its impat on price.

papers.title: Selective Call Out and Real Time Bidding
papers.problematic: Developing a joint optimization framework which optimizes over the allocation and well as solicitation.
papers.solution: Selective call out modelled as an online recurrent Bayesian decision framework with bandwidth type constraints.

papers.title: Smart Pacing for Effective Online Ad Campaign Optimization
papers.problematic: The liquidity makes price elasticity and bid landscape between demand and supply change quite dramatically. It is challenging to perform smooth pacing control and maximize campaign performance simultaneously.
papers.solution: We propose a smart pacing approach in which the delivery pace of each campaign is learned from both offline and online data to achieve smooth delivery and optimal performance goals.

papers.title: Scalable Hands-Free Transfer Learning for Online Advertising
papers.problematic: Building many models on massive data becomes prohibitively expensive computationally.
papers.solution: Combination of strategies: (i) transfer learning: Bayesian logistic regression trained with stochastic gradient descent (SGD) from the more expensive target data (ii) a new update rule for automatic learning rate adaptation, to support learning from sparse, high-dimensional data, as well as the integration with adaptive regularization.

papers.title: From 0.5 Million to 2.5 Million: Efficiently Scaling up Real-Time Bidding
papers.problematic: It is typical for a contemporary Real-Time Bidding system to receive millions of bid requests per second at peak time, and have a large portion of these to be irrelevant to any advertiser. Given a valuable bid request, tens of thousands of advertisements might be qualified for scoring.
papers.solution: Our bid request model treats the system load as a hierarchical resource allocation problem and directs traffic based on the estimated quality of bid requests. Our exploration/exploitation advertisement model selects a limited number of qualified advertisements for thorough scoring based on the expected value of a bid request to the advertiser given its features. Our combined bid request and advertisement model is able to win more auctions and bring more value to clients by stabilizing the bidding pipeline. Our deployed system is capable of handling 5x more bid requests.
papers.comments: Interesting article for efficiently scaling up using filter to only accept quality bid requests at peak times during the day. Good for Kwanko

papers.title: Network Analysis of Third Party Tracking
papers.problematic: Previous research has investigated tracking practices and tracking agencies associated with popular websites
papers.solution: We investigate the network properties of the third party referral structures that facilitate gathering of user information for the delivery of personalized ads

papers.title: Predicting Winning Price in Real Time Bidding with Censored Data
papers.problematic: Study how to predict the winning price such that the DSP can win the bid by placing a proper bidding value in the real-time bidding (RTB) auction. A major challenge is that a DSP usually suffers from the censoring of the winning price, especially for those lost bids in the past.
papers.solution: We utilize the censored regression model, which is widely used in the survival analysis and econometrics, to fit the censored bidding data.

papers.title: Large-scale behavioral targeting
Finding the right consumer: optimizing for conversion in display advertising campaigns
Learning to target: What works for behavioral targeting
Audience selection for on-line brand advertising: privacy friendly social network targeting
Design principles of massive, robust prediction systems
Estimating the effect of online display advertising on browser conversion
Ad Exchange: Research Issues
papers.problematic: an emerging way to sell and buy display ads on the Internet is via ad exchanges
papers.solution: Abstract a model for ad exchanges. Based on the model, we present research problems in auction theory, optimization and game theory. The goal is to present a blueprint for research in design, analyses and use of ad exchanges

papers.title: Truthful and efficient mechanisms for Website dependent advertising auctions
Targeting Display Advertising
The Impact of Privacy Policy on the Auction Market for Online Display
Media exposure through the funnel: A Model of Multi-stage Attribution
Does customization impact advertising effectiveness? an exploratory study of consume perceptions of advertising in customized online environments
Mapreduce: simplified data processing on large clusters
Statistical Models and Methods for Lifetime Data
A model for predicitve measurements of advertising effectiveness
Procurement auctions with pre-award subcontracting

author: A. Wambach
papers.title: How to subcontract?

author: M. Richardson
E. Dominowska
R. Ragno
papers.title: Predicting clicks: estimating the click-through rate for new ads
Modeling contextual factors of click rates

author: L. C. Ueltschy
R. F. Krampf
papers.title: The influence of acculturation on advertising effectiveness to the hispanic market
Expressive banner ad auctions and model-based online optimization for clearing
A combinatorial allocation mechanism with penalties for banner advertising
On the pricing of performance-based programmatic ad buying contracts
Real-time bidding strategies with on-line learning
Dealing with inventory risk: a solution to the market making problem
Applications of feedback control in online advertising
How fast is the bandit?
Supply Side Optimisation in Online Display Advertising (Doctoral dissertation)
Feedback control of real-time display advertising
Post-click conversion modeling and analysis for non-guaranteed delivery display advertising
Scalable distributed inference of dynamic user interest for behavioral targeting
A simple and scalable response prediction for display advertising
Item-based collaborative filtering recommendation algorithms
Collaborative filtering recommender system
Unifying user-based and item-based collaborative filtering approached by similarity fusion
papers.problematic: Memory-based methods for collaborative filtering predict new ratings by averaging (weighted) ratings between, respectively, pairs of similar users or items. In practice, a large number of ratings from similar users or similar items are not available, due to the sparsity inherent to rating data.
papers.solution: This paper re-formulates the memory-based collaborative filtering problem in a generative probabilistic framework, treating individual user-item ratings as predictors of missing ratings. The final rating is estimated by fusing predictions from three sources: predictions  based on ratings of the same item by other users, predictions based on different items made by the same user, and, third, ratings predicted based on data from other but similar users rating other but similar items.

papers.title: Real-time bidding benchmarking with ipinyou dataset
Applying convolutional neural networks concepts to hybrid nn-hmm model for speech recognition
Response prediction using collaborative filtering with hierarchies and side-information
papers.problematic: Response prediction is the problem of estimating theprobability thatanadvertisement isclicked when displayed onacontentpublisher‚Äôswebpag
papers.solution: We show how response prediction can be viewed as a problem of matrix completion,and propose to solve it using matrix factorization techniques from collaborative Ô¨Åltering(CF)

papers.title: Social network and click-through prediction with factorization machines
Optimal delivery of sponsored search advertisements subject to budget constraints
Online allocation of display ads with smooth delivery
Ad click prediction: a view from the trenches
Real-time bidding: A new frontier of computational advertising research
Click-through prediction for advertising in twitter timeline
Sources of variability in large-scale machine learning systems
Handbook of Massive Data Sets
Web-scale user modeling for targeting
The online advertising industry: economics, evolution, and privacy
Efficient online ad serving in a display advertising exchange
Recommender Systems
Pairwise interaction tensor factorization for personalized tag recommendation
Learning optimal ranking with tensor factorization for tag recommendation
CTR prediction for DSP with Improved Cube Factorization Model from Historical Bidding Log
Personalized click model through collaborative filtering
Click-through rate estimation for rare events in online advertising
A survey on real-time bidding advertising
Optimized bidding algorithm of real time bidding in online ads auction
Logistic regression in rare events data
Data mining problems in internet ad systems
Relational click prediction for sponsored search
Efficient scheduling of Internet banner advertisements
Smart useful, scary, creepy: perceptions of online behavioral advertising
Quasi-proportional mechanisms: prior-free revenue maximization
SHALE: an efficient algorithm for allocation of guaranteed display advertising
Tensor decompositions, alternating least squares and other tales
Collaborative filtering with temporal dynamics
A spatio-temporal approach to collaborative filtering
Stochastic methods for l1 regularized loss minimization
Contextual collaborative filtering via hierarchical matrix factorization
Computational advertising: The linkedin way
Data infrastructure at LinkedIn
Online budgeted matching in random input models with applications to adwords
Revenue analysis of a family of ranking rules for keyword auction
An adaptive algorithm for selecting profitable keywords for search based advertising services
Pricing guaranteed contracts in online display advertising
Optimal equilibrium bidding strategies for budget constrained bidders in sponsored search auctions
Performance-based pricing models in online advertising
Joint optimization of bid and budget allocation in sponsored search
Online primal-dual algorithms for maximizing ad-auctions revenue
Daily-deal selection for revenue maximization
Sensitive Webpage Classification for Content Advertising
Real Time Bidding in Online Digital Advertisement
Interactive Collaborative Filtering
User Response Learning for Directly Optimizing Campaign Performance in Display Advertising
Bid-aware Gradient Descent for Unbiased Learning with Censored Data in Display Advertising
papers.problematic: The predictions, such as bid landscape forecasting, click-through rate (CTR) estimation, and bid optimisation, are all operated in the pre-bid stage with full-volume bid request data. However, the training data is gathered in the post-bid stage with a strong bias towards the winning impressions.
papers.solution: We formulate CTR estimation and bid optimisation under such censored auction data. Derived from a survival model, we show that historic bid information is naturally incorporated to produce Bid-aware Gradient Descents (BGD) which controls both the importance and the direction of the gradient to achieve unbiased learning.

papers.title: Deep CTR Prediction in Display Advertising
papers.problematic: Click through rate (CTR) prediction of image ads is the core task of online display advertising systems, and logistic regression (LR) has been frequently applied as the prediction model. However, LR model lacks the ability of extracting complex and intrinsic nonlinear features from handcrafted high-dimensional image features, which limits its effectiveness.
papers.solution: we introduce a novel deep neural network (DNN) based model that directly predicts the CTR of an image ad based on raw image pixels and other basic features in one step. The DNN model employs convolution layers to automatically extract representative visual features from images, and nonlinear CTR features are then learned from visual features and other contextual features by using fully-connected layers.

papers.title: Frequency Capping in Online Advertising
papers.problematic: There are n advertisers. Each advertiser Ai has a value Vi, demand Di, and frequency cap Fi. Supply units arrive online, each one associated with a user.
papers.solution: The goal is to design an online allocation algorithm maximizing total value.

papers.title: User-Based and Item-based Collaborative Filtering Recommendation algorithms Design
A recommender system for online advertising
papers.problematic: Recommender systems will analyze and filter complex data methodically to provide essential and usefule information to customers.
papers.solution: Presented an efficient recommender algorithm based on user browsing behavior

papers.title: Inventory Allocation for Online Graphical Display Advertising
papers.problematic: We discuss a multi-objective/goal programming model for the allocation of inventory of graphical advertisements.
papers.solution: We investigate various advertiser and publisher objectives such as (a) revenue from the sale of impressions, clicks and conversions, (b) future revenue from the sale of NGD inventory, and (c) 'fairness' of allocation.

papers.title: On word-of-mouth based discovery of the web
papers.problematic: Word-of-mouth based content discovery has become a major driver of traffic to many web sites today.
papers.solution: We present a detailed analysis of word-of-mouth exchange of URLs among Twitter users. We show that Twitter yields propagation trees that are wider than they are deep. Our analysis on the geolocation of users indicates that users who are geographically close together are more likely to share the same URL.

papers.title: Electronic word-of-mouth: Challenges and opportunities
papers.problematic: Thanks to the advances of information technology and the emergence of online social network sites, word-of-mouth has been recognized as one of the most influential resources of information transmission.
papers.solution: This paper describes online interpersonal influence or electronic word-of-mouth (eWOM) because it plays a significant role in consumer purchase decisions.

papers.title: Maximizing the Spread of Influence through a social network
papers.problematic: If we can try to convince a subset of individuals to adopt a new product or innovation, and the goal is to trigger a large cascade of further adoptions, which set of individuals should we target?
papers.solution: Using an analysis framework based on submodular functions, we show that a natural greedy strategy obtains a  solution that is provably within 63% of optimal for several classes of models...

papers.title: Television Advertising and Online Word-of-Mouth: An Empirical Investigation of Social TV Activity
papers.problematic: We investigate the relationship between television advertising and online word-of-mouth by examining the joint consumption of television programming and production of social media by television viewers, termed social TV. We explore how television advertising impacts the volume of online WOM about advertised brands and about the programs in which the advertisements air. We also examine what encourages or discourages viewers to engage in this particular social TV activity.
papers.solution: Using data containing television advertising instances and the volume of minute-by-minute social media mentions, our analyses reveal that television advertising impacts the volume of online WOM for both the brand advertised and the program in which the advertisement airs.

papers.title: Predicting the influence of users' posted information for eWOM advertising in social networks
papers.problematic: Facebook offers a service allowing marketers to utilize users' posts to automatically generate advertisements. The effectiveness of this spractice depends on the ability to accurately predict a post's influence on its readers.
papers.solution: We propose two models for predicting the influence of a post usingboth sources of influence, post-and author-related features, as predictors.

papers.title: The influence of eWOM in social media on consumers' purchase intentions: An extended approach to information adoption
